thread.title: Trevor Noah: ACLU interview cutting out was a 'broadcast glitch'

author: USA TODAY
title: Trevor Noah: ACLU interview cutting out was a 'broadcast glitch'
text:

Romero cut to black mid-interview. Post to Facebook Trevor Noah: ACLU interview cutting out was a 'broadcast glitch' The 'Daily Show' hosts's chat with ACLU head Anthony D. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Trevor Noah: ACLU interview cutting out was a 'broadcast glitch' Jayme Deerwester , USA TODAY Published 8:19 a.m. ET Feb. 1, 2017 | Updated 21 minutes ago Trevor Noah got a scare while watching the playback of Tuesday's 'Daily Show.' (Photo: Jason Kempin, Getty Images for Comedy Central) 
"What just happened?" a startled Trevor Noah tweeted while watching the broadcast of his own program Tuesday night. "Was that just my TV?" 
His Daily Show interview with Anthony D. Romero, the head of the American Civil Liberties Union, cut out unexpectedly as they were discussing President Trump's executive order temporarily suspending the U.S. refugee program and immigration from seven predominantly Muslim countries and the people affected by it. When the screen went to black, Romero was talking about Hameed Khalid Darweesh , an Iraqi translator who was detained for 18 hours at New York's JFK airport over the weekend. The Comedy Central logo remained at the bottom of the screen. #Dailyshow cut to black mid interview with Executive Director of ACLU Anthony Romero while discussing trump and Muslim ban. pic.twitter.com/tpLzlKtAmJ 
A relieved Noah later provided an update: "Just a broadcast glitch." He added, "It's not happening yet people," half-joking that the show wasn't being censored, "yet." OK. Just a broadcast glitch. It's not happening yet people. See you tomorrow good people! â€” Trevor Noah (@Trevornoah) February 1, 2017 
You can watch the full interview here . <!--iframe--> Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2jWHYjs NEVER MISS OUT Life Be a pop culture maven. Get the news, reviews and the juiciest celebrity stories that keep you in the know, Monday-Friday. THANKS FOR SIGNING UP FOR THE Life NEWSLETTER 
We're sorry.
